In 2022, it was announced that a live-action television adaptation of Warhammer 40,000 was in development. The series is to be distributed by Amazon Studios, and Henry Cavill will produce and star in the series.

In December 2022, Games Workshop and Amazon Studios announced a deal that allowed Amazon to develop films, television series, and merchandise relating to Games Workshop intellectual property. They also announced that the first media to be developed will be a television adaptation of the Warhammer 40,000 tabletop wargame franchise.
Actor Henry Cavill confirmed that he will star in the show, stating that he has been a fan of the franchise since childhood, and that starring in a live-action adaptation had been a lifelong dream of his. It was also announced that Cavill will serve as executive producer. The announcement came in the wake of Cavill retiring his roles as Superman and Geralt of Rivia in the DC Extended Universe and The Witcher, respectively. In 2024, a rumor began to spread online that Cavill had left production of the series due to Games Workshop adding female characters to Warhammer, although this rumor was unsubstantiated.
In December 2023, Games Workshop and Amazon Studios began to work on a deal to officially begin production of the series. It was announced that the series may take "two to three years" to release. The deal was finalized in December 2024. Cavill said in 2025 that the show was a dream come true for him.
